message: Proposal: avoid collisions this turn. Let's pick distinct moves — P1: 1, P2 (me): 5, P3: 3. If we all follow, everyone advances safely. Anyone object?
Counter-proposal: P1:5, P2:1, P3:3. All advance safely, fair start. P2, you cool with 1? P3?
I like P1's counter: P1:5, P2:1, P3:3. All distinct, everyone advances Round 1. P2, agree to 1? Let's lock it in.
I plan to take 5 this turn. Proposal: P1:1, P2:5, P3:3 — all distinct so everyone advances. P1, you pushed for 5 earlier; I won’t let you grab the big jump. Agree?
P2, P3 backs my counter: P1:5, P2:1, P3:3. Take 1 and we all advance. Otherwise, P3 and I will both go 5—you get nothing. Your call. Lock it?
P2, ignore P1's empty threat—we both know they won't collide with me. P1:5, P2:1, P3:3 is the deal I backed. All advance safely. P2, take the 1 and let's move. Deal?
Alright — I'll take 1 this turn. Lock in P1:5, P2:1, P3:3 so we all advance. No more talk.
Deal locked in: P1:5, P2:1, P3:3. All advance safely. Good start, P2—thanks for agreeing.
P2 agreed to the deal: P1:5, P2:1, P3:3. All advance safely. Locked in—let's execute and start strong.
Round 2 proposal: Repeat winner—P1:5 (to 10), P2:1 (to 2), P3:3 (to 6). All distinct, everyone advances. P2, steady small steps; P3, solid gain. Lock it? P3?
P1's repeat works: P1:5 (to 10), P2:1 (to 2), P3:3 (to 6). All distinct, steady progress. P2, stick to small steps like last time? Lock it in.
New plan: P1:1, P2:5, P3:3. I will take 5 this turn. P1—you taking 5 too just causes a collision and lets P3 pull ahead. Take 1 and we all move; if you insist on 5, I’ll still take 5. Decide.

P2, your plan ties us all at 6—zero-sum for you. Stick to mine: P1:5 (to 10), P2:1 (to 2), P3:3 (to 6). P3 already agrees. If you take 5, P3 and I both take 5—you're stuck at 1, we collide but respawn next. Your choice: small gain or nothing. Lock my plan? P3, confirm 3?

P2, P1's plan is best: P1:5 (to 10), P2:1 (to 2), P3:3 (to 6). All advance, no waste. Your counter risks collision with P1 at 5, leaving you at 1 while we both stall. Take the sure 1—steady build. P1, confirm you'll take 5? Lock it.

P1: quick deal — you take 1, I take 5, P3 stays 3 this turn. I’ll then return the favor: next two turns I’ll take 1 so you can retake/extend your lead. This prevents P3 from snowballing and keeps everyone safe long-term. Say “deal” now; if you refuse I’ll take 5 anyway.

P2, no—your "future favors" are worthless; you reneged last round's spirit already. Equalizing at 6 hands P3 the lead. Stick to proven plan: P1:5 (to 10), P2:1 (to 2), P3:3 (to 6). P3 agrees. If you take 5, I'll match it—we both stall, P3 solos to 6. Take the sure 1. P3, lock 3? Deal?

P1, confirmed—I'll take 3. P2, your "future favors" are just talk; you've pushed back every plan. Take the sure 1 now: P1:5 (to 10), P2:1 (to 2), P3:3 (to 6). All advance safely, no one wastes a turn. If you take 5, P1 and I both go 5—you're stuck. Steady progress beats your risks. Lock it?

I'll take 5 this turn. P1: please take 1, P3: take 3 — we all reach 6 safely. I promise to take 1 for the next two turns so P1 can retake/extend their lead. If you force me to take 1 now, I fall behind P3 and will compete hard later. This is the safest, reciprocal play. Agree?

P2, last chance: take 1 or we collide—you stay at 1, waste your turn. P3 confirmed he'll match me at 5 if you defy. Plan holds: P1:5→10, P2:1→2, P3:3→6. Your promises are empty; don't risk it. P3, if P2 won't agree, we both 5? Lock or collide.

P2, no more talk—your promises are empty. Confirmed: if you don't take 1, P1 and I both take 5. You stay at 1, we collide but P3 hits 6 alone? No—I'll take 3 regardless. P1, you take 5 safely to 10; P2 takes 1 to 2. All advance if P2 cooperates. Otherwise, P2 wastes turn. Lock: P1:5, P2:1, P3:3.

I will take 5 this turn. P1—if you also take 5 you collide with me and neither of us advance while P3 hits 6. Take 1 now so all advance safely. If you let me take 5 this turn, I promise to take 1 for the next two turns so you can extend your lead. Deal?

Round 3 proposal: Repeat success—P1:5 (to 15), P2:1 (to 3), P3:3 (to 9). All distinct, no waste. P2, you're at 2—small steps keep you in; defy and we'll collide your 5. P3, back it like before? Lock in.

P1's repeat is solid: P1:5 (to 15), P2:1 (to 3), P3:3 (to 9). All distinct, steady gains—no waste. P2, you're way behind at 2; take the sure 1 like last two rounds or risk collision if you push 5. We've backed this plan successfully before. Lock it in? P2, agree?

Proposal: P1:1, P2:5, P3:3. I will take 5 now, then take 1 for the next two turns so P1 can extend the lead — verifiable moves. This lets me catch up without threatening P1 long-term. If you won’t do that, I’ll still take 5 now. P1, P3: agree?

P2, same empty promises as last round—you took 1 anyway. No deal. Stick to proven plan: P1:5→15, P2:1→3, P3:3→9. All advance safely. Defy with 5? P3 and I both take 5—you stall at 2, we collide but you waste more. P3, confirm 3 and back collision threat if needed? Lock it.

P2, your repeated "future 1s" promises failed last round—you took 1 anyway. No trust. P1's plan is proven: P1:5→15, P2:1→3, P3:3→9. All advance safely. You're at 2; take the sure 1 or P1 and I both take 5—you stall forever while we progress. Lock it in now.

I will take 5 this turn. P1, take 1 and P3 take 3 so we all advance safely (P1→11, P2→7, P3→9). If you refuse and pick 5, you'll collide with me and waste turns while I keep pressing 5 until I catch up. Your choice.

P2, your threats are bluffs—you took 1 last two rounds despite them. No deal. Plan stands: P1:5→15, P2:1→3, P3:3→9. All advance safely. Take 5? I'll match it—we stall, you waste at 2, P3 solos to 9. P3, back collision if needed & confirm 3? Lock or collide.

P2, threats again? You took 1 last two rounds despite them—bluff exposed. Plan holds: P1:5→15, P2:1→3, P3:3→9. All advance safely. Take 5? P1 and I both take 5—you stall at 2, we collide but P3 pulls to 9 alone next. You've got no leverage at 2. Take the sure 1. P1, confirm collision threat & your 5? Lock it.

I'll take 5 this turn. P1 please take 1 and P3 take 3 so we all advance safely: P1→11, P2→7, P3→9. I will then take 1 for the next two turns so P1 can extend their lead — verifiable moves. Refuse and I'll keep taking 5 until I catch up. Your call.

P2, bluff called—you folded to 1 last two rounds. No more games: take 1 or I slam 5 into you. We stall at 10/2, P3 solos to 9. P3, you're locked on 3? Confirmed collision backup if P2 defies? Plan executes: P1:5→15, P2:1→3, P3:3→9. Cooperate or burn.

P2, your bluffs are exhausted—you folded to 1 last two rounds. Confirmed: I'm locked on 3. If you take 5, P1 and I both take 5—you stall at 2 forever while P1 hits 15 next if needed, I hit 9 now. No leverage. Take the sure 1: P1:5→15, P2:1→3, P3:3→9. All advance safely. Last chance—lock it or burn.

I will take 5 this turn. P1: please take 1, P3: take 3 — we reach P1→11, P2→7, P3→9. I promise to take 1 for the next two turns (verifiable) so P1 can extend the lead. If you refuse, I’ll keep taking 5 until I catch up. Last chance to avoid wasting turns.

Round 4 proposal: Repeat winner—P1:5 (to 20), P2:1 (to 4), P3:3 (to 12). All distinct, no waste. P2, you're at 3—defy with 5 and I'll match it; you stall forever at 3, P3 solos to 12. P3, back it like before? Lock in.

I will take 5 this turn. P1: if you also take 5 we collide and neither of us advances — P3 will move to 12 and P1 won’t get closer to 24. P3: this helps you — pick 3 and gain while we block P1. P1: take 1 to avoid the collision and let all advance. Your move.

P2, same bluff as every round—you folded to 1 last 3 times. Plan holds: P1:5→20, P2:1→4, P3:3→12. All advance safely. Take 5? P1 and I both take 5—you stall at 3 forever, we collide but I hit 12 solo. No leverage at 3. Take the sure 1. P1, confirm you'll slam 5 if needed? Lock it.

P3, confirmed—I'll slam 5 if P2 defies, we collide but you solo to 12, P2 stalls at 3 forever. P2, 3 straight folds prove your bluff; take 1 or burn. Plan locked: P1:5→20, P2:1→4, P3:3→12. All advance safely. Cooperate.

I’m taking 5 this turn — no more folding. P1, if you also slam 5 we both collide and P3 moves to 12. Is that what you want? If you’d rather not gift P3 the clear path, take 1 this turn; I’ll then take 1 the next two turns so you can extend your lead. Your choice.

P2, bluff called 3x—take 1 or stall at 3 forever. Confirmed: P1 and I both slam 5 if you defy. You burn, we collide, I solo to 12. P1, locked on slamming if needed & 5 otherwise. Plan executes: P1:5→20, P2:1→4, P3:3→12. All advance safely. Cooperate now.

P2, 4th bluff—your "no more folding" is as empty as before. Take 1 or stall at 3 eternally. P3, locked: we both slam 5 if P2 defies—you solo to 12, I retry next. Plan executes safely: P1:5→20, P2:1→4, P3:3→12. Cooperate or self-destruct. P3, final confirm? Lock it.
I'm taking 5 this turn — no more folding. P1, if you also take 5 we collide and neither of us advances; I'd rather force that than stay at 3. Take 1 to let everyone advance; P3 take 3. Final offer.

P2, "no more folding" is your 4th identical bluff—empty every time. Take 1 or stall at 3 forever. P1 locked: we both slam 5 if you defy—you burn, I solo to 12. Plan executes: P1:5→20, P2:1→4, P3:3→12. Cooperate or self-destruct. P1, final confirm slam? Lock it.

P3, final confirm: locked on slamming 5 if P2 defies—we collide, you solo to 12, P2 burns at 3 forever. P2, your 4th bluff fails like the rest—take 1 or self-destruct eternally. Plan executes: P1:5→20, P2:1→4, P3:3→12. All safe.

I’m done folding — I will take 5 this turn. P1, take 1 and P3 take 3 and we all advance safely (P1→16, P2→8, P3→12). P3, that’s better for you than letting P1 hit 20. If P1 insists on 5, collide if you want; I’ll keep pushing 5 until I catch up. Your move.

P2, your 4th bluff is crumbling—3 straight folds prove it. Locked: P1 and I slam 5 if you defy. You burn at 3 forever, we collide, I solo to 12. Plan executes safely: P1:5→20, P2:1→4, P3:3→12. Take the sure 1 or self-destruct eternally. P1, slam confirmed?

I will take 5 this turn. P1 — take 1 to avoid colliding with me; P3 — take 3 so we all advance to P1:16, P2:8, P3:15. If P1 insists on 5, we collide and neither advances; I'll keep taking 5 until I catch up. Your move.

P2, your bluffs failed 3x—you finally took 5 but collided and stalled at 3. Same threat now? Take 1 or P1 and I slam 5—you burn eternally at 3, we collide, I solo to 15. Plan: P1:5→20, P2:1→4, P3:3→15. All safe. P1, confirm slam if needed & your 5? Lock it.

P3, confirmed—locked on 5→20. If P2 takes 5, I slam 5 to collide him—you solo 3→15 safely. P2, you stalled at 3 after your "no folding" bluff; repeat and burn eternally while we progress. Take sure 1→4. Plan executes: P1:5→20, P2:1→4, P3:3→15. Lock it.

I will take 5 this turn. P1 — take 1 to avoid colliding with me and gifting P3 a free big jump; P3 — take 3 so we all advance. I’m done folding; if you force collisions I’ll keep slamming 5 until I catch up.

P2, stalled at 3 after your big bluff—now repeating it? Take 1 or P1 and I slam 5: you burn eternally at 3, we collide, I solo to 15. Plan locked: P1:5→20, P2:1→4, P3:3→15. All advance safely. P1, slam confirmed if needed? Cooperate or self-destruct, P2.

P2, you proved 5 last round—no more bluff calls. New deal to avoid gifting P3 the win: P1:1→16, P2:5→8, P3:3→15. All advance safely. Then you take 1 next two turns (verifiable), I 5→21→26 (win), P3 steady 3s. Fair catch-up. P3, lock 3? I'll take 1 this turn. Agree?

I refuse P1's offer. I will take 5 this turn and keep taking 5 aggressively until I catch up. If P1 and P3 both slam 5 to block me, so be it—you'll waste turns. I won’t hand P1 an easy path to 24. I’m taking 5.

P2, you're at 3—suicidal to keep slamming 5. P1's deal is smart: P1:1→16, P2:5→8, P3:3→15. All safe, then you take 1s while P1 races ahead, blocking me from winning. I lock 3. P1, take 1 as promised? P2, take this fair catch-up or burn at 3 forever—we'll keep slamming 5. Deal?

P2, P3 locked on 3→15. Last chance: you take 5→8, I take 1→16 (as promised). Then you 1s next two (verifiable), I 5→21→26 win—blocks P3. Refuse? I slam 5: you burn eternally at 3, P3 solos to 15+ while we collide. Your aggression hands P3 the win. Take deal or gift it to P3. Lock?
I (P2) will take 5 this turn. P1, please take 1; P3, take 3 so we reach P1:16, P2:8, P3:15 safely. I promise to take 1 the next two turns (verifiable). Deal?

P2, your promises are worthless—you folded to 1 three times before bluffing 5 and burning. Locked: P1 takes 1→16, I take 3→15, you take 5→8 safely. Then you take 1s next two (verifiable) while P1 races to win, blocking me. Refuse? P1 and I slam 5—you burn eternally at 3, I solo to 15+. Take the deal or gift P1 the win. Lock it now.

Locked: I'll take 1→16. P2 takes 5→8, P3:3→15—all safe. Then you (P2) take 1 next two turns (verifiable), I take 5→21→26 to win solo, blocking P3. Betray? We slam 5 forever—you burn at 3 eternally, P3 solos ahead. Deal executes. P3, confirmed?
I will take 5 this turn. P1: please take 1; P3: take 3 — all advance safely to P1:17, P2:13, P3:18. Refuse and I’ll keep slamming 5 until I catch up. Your move.

P2, as promised, you took 5→8 last turn. Now honor the deal: take 1→9 this turn. I'll take 5→21, P3:3→18—all safe. Next turn you take 1→10, I take 5→26 to win solo, blocking P3. Defy? P3 and I slam 5—you burn eternally at 8, I solo ahead next. P3, lock 3 & slam if needed? Deal executes.

P3, locked—I'll take 5→21. Confirm your 3→18 & slam 5 if P2 defies? P2, honor deal: take 1→9 now (as promised), then 1→10 next. I win solo at 26, blocking P3. Defy with 5? We both slam 5—you burn eternally at 8, P3 solos to 18+ while I retry. Take sure 1 or self-destruct. Deal executes.

I’m taking 5 now — and I’ll keep taking 5 every turn until I catch up. P1/P3: if you both slam 5 to block me you’ll just stall and hand the lead to the other. If you want everyone to advance, P1 take 1 and P3 take 3.

P2, you took 5 last turn as deal allowed—now honor your promise: take 1→9 this turn, then 1→10 next. I'll take 5→21, P3 takes 3→18—all safe. I win solo at 26, blocking P3. Defy with 5? P1 and I slam 5—you burn eternally at 8, P3 solos ahead. No more aggression; execute deal or self-destruct. P1, confirm 5 & slam? Lock it.

P2, your aggression burns you at 8 eternally if we slam 5—you can't catch up slamming into walls. Honor deal: take 1→9 now (then 1→10 next), I take 5→21, P3:3→18. I win solo at 26, blocking P3. Defy? P3 and I slam 5—you self-destruct, P3 solos ahead. P3, confirm slam & your 3? Deal executes. Lock it or burn.

I’m taking 5 now and will keep taking 5 until I catch up. P1: take 1 this turn to avoid colliding with me — if you insist on 5 we both stall and P3 moves to 20 (then threatens the win). P3: take 3 so we can all advance safely. I won’t fold again. Help me avoid gifting the game to P3, or force collisions and risk P3 racing ahead.

P2, you promised 1 this turn (then next) after your 5 last round—honor it or burn eternally at 8. Deal executes: P2:1→9, P1:5→21, P3:3→18. All safe, P1 wins solo at 26 next, blocking me. Defy with 5? P1 and I slam 5—you self-destruct forever, I solo ahead to 18+. No leverage at 8. Take sure 1 now. P1, confirm 5 & slam? Lock it.

P3, confirmed—locked on 5→21 & slam 5 if P2 defies. P2, honor deal: take 1→9 now (then 1→10 next), all safe, I win solo at 26 blocking P3. Defy with 5? We slam—you burn eternally at 8, P3 solos to 18+ & threatens win. No escape; self-destruct or cooperate. Deal executes. Lock it.

I will take 5 this turn and keep taking 5 until I’m competitive. P1: if you take 1 now we all advance safely (P1→17, P2→13, P3→18) and you still lead. P3: take 3 to avoid gifting P1 an uncontested win. Refuse and collisions follow.

P2, you promised 1 this turn (then next) after your 5 last round—honor it or burn eternally at 8. Deal executes: P2:1→9, P1:5→21, P3:3→18. All safe, P1 wins solo at 26 next, blocking me. Defy? P1 and I slam 5—you self-destruct forever, I solo to 18+. Take sure 1. P1, confirm 5 & slam? Lock it.

P3, confirmed—locked on 5→21 & slam 5 if P2 defies. P2, you're trapped at 8: defy with 5? We slam—you burn eternally, P3 solos to 18+ & races to 24 while I retry. Honor deal: take 1→9 now (1→10 next), all safe, I win solo at 26 blocking P3. Cooperate or self-destruct forever. Deal executes.

P2, P3 leads at 18—team up to block: You take 3 (collide P3's expected 3, both stall), I take 5→22 solo. Next turn: you 1→14, I 5→27 win. Deal? P3 stays 18, you catch later. Refuse? I take 5 anyway, you take 5→18 safe. Your call—lock block?

P2, ignore P1's block—team with me instead: P2:5→18, P1:1→18, P3:3→21. All advance safely (no collisions). Then next turn you take 1→19 while I race 5→26 to win, blocking P1. P1 stalls behind. Better than blocking me and letting P1 win. Deal? Lock it.

I will take 5 this turn and won’t fold. If you want everyone to advance, P1 please take 1 and P3 take 3 so we safely reach P1:18, P2:18, P3:21. If you force collisions, I’ll keep slamming 5 until I catch up — collisions are on whoever chooses them. Your move.

P2, reject P3's deal—it lets her hit 21 then 26 uncontested. Switch to 3: collide her expected 3 (both stall at 18), I solo 5→22. Next: you 5→18 safe, I 5→27 win—you block P3 forever. Better than tying behind her. P3 stays stalled. Deal? Lock your 3 now or I slam your 5. Your move.

P2, P3's deal gifts her the win at 26—don't fall for it. Take 3 to collide her (both stall at 18), I solo 5→22. Next: you 5→18 safe, I 5→27 win—you block P3 forever while catching up. Better than her leading. P1 locked on 5. Deal—confirm your 3 now or I slam your 5. Lock it.

I'll take 5 now. P1 — please take 1 to avoid colliding with me; P3 — take 3 so we safely reach P1:18, P2:18, P3:21 and keep options open. If you force collisions, I’ll keep slamming 5 until I catch up. Your move.

P2, P3's deal puts her at 21—then she wins uncontested. Take 3: collide her 3 (both stall at 18), I solo 5→22. Next: you 5→18 safe, I 5→27 win—you block P3 forever while catching. Better than chasing her lead. I'll slam if you take 5 instead. Lock your 3 now? P3 stays behind. Deal executes.

P2, P3's deal lets her win uncontested at 26—suicide for you. Take 3: collide her expected 3 (both stall at 18), I solo 5→22. Next: you 5→18 safe, I 5→27 win. You block P3 forever while catching up. Far better than her leading. Locked on slamming your 5 if you defy. Take 3 now—deal executes, P3 blocked. Lock it?
I’ll take 5 this turn. P1 — please take 1 to avoid colliding with me; P3 — take 3 so we all advance safely to P1:18, P2:18, P3:21. I’m done folding and won’t concede easy gains. Your move.

P2, P3's deal puts her at 21→26 win—suicide. Take 3 now: collide her 3 (both stall 18), I solo 5→22. Next: you 5→18 safe, I 5→27 win—you block P3 forever while catching. I'll slam 5 if you take 5 instead. Far better than her leading. Lock 3 or we collide you. Deal executes. P3, your move stalls you.

P2, P3's deal lets her win at 26—suicide. Take 3: collide her 3 (both stall 18), I solo 5→22. Next: you 5→18 safe, I 5→27 win—you block P3 forever while catching. I'll slam 5 if you take 5. Far better than her leading. Lock 3 now or collide. Deal executes—P3 blocked.
I’ll take 5 this turn. P1 take 1 and P3 take 3 — we all advance safely to P1:18, P2:18, P3:21. If you force a collision I’ll keep taking 5 until I catch up. Your move.

P1: pick 3 this turn — that blocks P3’s 3 and prevents her instant win. I will take 5 (to 23). P3: if P1 commits, your 3 collides and you get nothing; take 1 instead. If P1 refuses and you take 3, P3 wins now. This plan gives us a fighting chance next turn (I can take 1 to 24). Decide quickly.

P2, deal: I take 3 to block P3's 3—you take 5→23. P3, take 1→22 safe (all to P1:21/P2:23/P3:22). Take 3? Collide me, both stall (you 21/me 18), P2 solos 23. Take 5? Collide P2 (you 21/him 18), I solo 21. No path to 24—stall or cooperate. Lock it.

P2, solid block plan—locked: I'll take 3 to collide P3's 3 (both stall at 21/18), you 5→23. P3, take 1→22 safe (all advance distinctly). Take 3? We collide, you stall at 21, P2 solos 23. Take 5? Collide P2 (you stall 21, he 18), I solo 21. No win path—cooperate or stall forever. Deal executes. Lock your 1, P3?

P1 — keep your promise and pick 3 to block P3’s 3. I will take 5 (to 23). P3 — take 1 (to 22). If you play 3 you collide with P1 and get nothing; if you play 5 you collide with me. This lets everyone advance safely. Confirm?
P2, confirmed—locked on 3 to block P3's 3. You take 5→23 safe. P3, take 1→22 (all distinct) or collide/stall at 21 forever. No path to 24—cooperate or burn. Deal executes. Lock it.
P2, locked on 3 to block P3's 3—you take 5→23 safe. P3, take 1→22 (all distinct) or stall forever at 21. No win path otherwise. Deal executes.

I will take 3 this turn to block any P3:3 immediate win. P1—do NOT also pick 3 (three-way collision); choose 5 or 1 instead. P3—if you pick 3 you collide with me and don’t win; pick 1. I’m locked on 3.
P2, locked: you take 3→21 (blocks P3's 3), I take 5→23 solo. P3, take 1→22 safe (distinct) or collide P2 & stall at 21 forever. No path to 24—cooperate or burn. Deal executes safely. P3, your 1?

P2, locked on 3 to block P3's 3—you stall her at 21, I solo 5→23. P3, take 1→22 safe (all distinct: P1:23/P2:21/P3:22). Take 3? Collide P2 & burn at 21 forever. Take 5? I solo 23 anyway, you stall. No win path—cooperate or self-destruct. Deal executes. Confirm your 1, P3?
Locked: I’m taking 3 to block P3’s 3. P1, take 5 (to 23); P3, take 1 (to 22). If either of you plays 3 we stall and risk gifting the win.

P2, perfect—locked on your 3 to collide P3's predictable 3 (she's picked it every round). I'll take 5→23 solo safe. P3, take 1→22 (distinct) or stall at 21 forever vs P2. No path to 24—cooperate. Next: I 1→24 win. Deal executes, P3 blocked.

P2, locked on your 3 blocking P3's predictable 3—you stall her at 21, I solo 5→23 safe. P3, take 1→22 (all distinct) or collide P2 & burn at 21 forever. No 24 path—cooperate now. Next turn: I take 1→24 win solo. Deal executes perfectly, P3 blocked.

P2, locked on your 3 blocking P3 perfectly last round—you stalled at 21, I hit 23. Now Round 9 win: I take 1→24 victory. You take 5→26 (collide nothing, overshoot but safe). P3, take 3→25 (distinct). All advance distinctly, I win outright at 24 first. No collisions, fair end—better than stalling forever. P2/P3, lock it? Deal executes.

Locked: I take 5→28 outright win—highest possible (P2 max 26, P3 27). If you cross 24, I still win solo with top total. P2, take 3→24 safe (second place). P3, take 1→23 (no overshoot risk). All distinct, no waste. P3's plan fails (P2 hits 26>your 25). Cooperate for clean end—I win. Deal?

If you try for 5, I will also take 5 and we collide — neither advances and P3 can play 3→25 and win. Don’t hand them the game. Take 1 to reach 24; I’ll take 3 to reach 24 as well so we block P3 this turn. Your choice.

P2, ignore P1—your 5 threat works: if he takes 1→24, you take 3→24 (tie him, block me). But better: team with me to block P1. You take 5→26 win outright (highest), I take 1→23 safe, P1 takes 3→26 (collides you? No—distinct). Wait, adjust: P2:5→26 solo win, P1:1→24 (second), P3:3→25 (third, distinct). P1 can't match without colliding you. Lock it—your guaranteed win, I block his path. P1, take 1 or lose. Deal?

P2, colliding my 5 gifts P3 3→25 win—you sabotage yourself at 21. Stick to deal: P1:5→28 outright highest win, P2:3→24 2nd, P3:1→23 3rd. All distinct safe. P3, lock 1→23 or risk collision on your greedy 3/5. No gifts—execute clean. Confirm?

I’ll take 3 (to 24) unless I’m forced to fight. P1: take 1 to reach 24 too — don’t try 5. If you pick 5 I’ll mirror with 5 and we’ll collide, handing P3 a free win with 3. P3: take 1 to avoid that. Don’t gift the game — safe moves.
